holidays.name: World Book Day
holidays.description: A celebration dedicated to books and reading, encouraging people of all ages to discover the joy of literature and storytelling.
holidays.origin: Established by UNESCO in 1995 to promote reading, publishing, and the protection of intellectual property.
holidays.funFact: April 23 is chosen because it is the date of death of William Shakespeare, Miguel de Cervantes, and Inca Garcilaso de la Vega, three literary legends.

holidays.name: Talk Like Shakespeare Day
holidays.description: A quirky day where people try to speak using the Bard's iconic Shakespearean English, embracing 'thee,' 'thou,' and poetic insults.
holidays.origin: Unofficial fun observance inspired by the enduring popularity of Shakespeare’s works.
holidays.funFact: On this day, you might overhear people saying things like 'Thou art as fat as butter!' in offices and social media!

holidays.name: National Talk Like Yoda Day
holidays.description: Fans celebrate the wisdom and quirky syntax of Star Wars’ beloved Jedi Master, Yoda, by mimicking his unique way of speaking.
holidays.origin: Started by Star Wars fans to honor Yoda's quirky linguistic style, unofficially observed on April 23.
holidays.funFact: Yoda’s distinctive object-subject-verb syntax inspired linguists to study how language shapes thinking.

holidays.name: World Tapir Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to raising awareness about the peculiar and endangered tapirs — the 'living fossils' of the animal world with a snout like a short trunk.
holidays.origin: Organized by conservation groups to highlight tapir species and encourage habitat protection.
holidays.funFact: Tapirs have been around since the age of dinosaurs and use their flexible snout like a mini trunk!
